children.subject:
Labs will be remote and lab section will include a presentation from a lab TA and time to ask questions and get help on the labs. At least one lab section will be recorded for students with time conflicts. EDIT: Lab checkoffs will be "in person" so students will need to be online at specific times. 

All times listed online (lecture, discussion, and lab) might change now that the class is online only, since we want have options that work well in a range of time zones. We encourage students to attend the "live" sections, but there will be recordings available for students with conflicts.

I should also add that we are trying our best to ensure minimal loss of educational content for the at-home labs.

For example, for the touchscreen lab we will most likely be shipping kits of physical parts to all students who can then work on breadboard exercises on their own (with the remote guidance of lab TAs of course).

We are also thinking of adding some more simulator based problems in the lab section of the class, which will familiarize the students with simulation software used to design circuits in the industry.

We are all very invested in this and are trying to make the best out of the current situation, while ensuring a safe learning environment.

What will lab sections be like for EECS 16A since it will be online?

From,

Ryota Inagaki
Yes, we will be hiring both. Please do apply if interested.
Are there still opportunities for homework readers or lab assistants?
Hiring is not complete yet.
Have any responses been sent out? I applied for a TA position but haven't heard back yet.
We are trying to restructure the lab so that we ship a fundamental component kit to the students, in which case the fee would apply.
I enrolled in the class and saw that there is a $10 fee, for lab supplies I think. This still applies even though the course will be online?
Yes, the class will most likely be expanded. Not sure by how much though - we need to get departmental approval, so be sure to get on the waitlist earlier rather than later.
Ok, thanks! Do you have an idea of about when this will happen?
Some time early next week would be my prediction, but it's not entirely up to me.

I'm interested in potentially taking 16A this summer, but the class is currently full (90/90). Given that the waitlist has 100 spots, do you anticipate that the class will be expanded to accommodate people on the waitlist?
Hiring is still on-going.
Any updates on the hiring of course staff?
Students will be allowed to attend any discussion section regardless of what they are registered for, so you don't need to officially swap.
Hello! My lab section 104 was cancelled and I got moved to lab section 101. Now, my lab and discussion sections overlap with each other. Is it possible to swap only my discussion section? Thank you!

Welcome to Berkeley! We'll be sending out a link in the next week or so to order 16A kits for the summer. If you're enrolled in the course, you'll also get this information via email, along with any other announcements before the course starts.

Thank you Grace! I heard that if someone is still on the waitlist for CS61A for the summer session, the class won't expand until phase 2. Is this correct?

Could someone clarify what phase 1 and 2 are for summer sessions only (not fall semester)? Since phase 2 starts later than phase 1, wouldn't the student be behind? in the course?

To my knowledge, the "phases" are only for the semesters, not the summer. I think at this point CS61A will not expand beyond the current capacity of 720 students, but if other enrolled students drop the course you still might get into the class.

Thank you! I set a swap for 16A (enrolled) and 61A (I am waitlisted) before. I am now 6th on the waitlist for 61A and once I am enrolled for 61A, I will drop the 16A class.

I filled out the form for 16A lab sections and kit ordering and choose shipping (since I am located on the US East Coast). Would it be possible to get a refund on the 16A kit ordering if I get enrolled in 61A? By what time should I contact eecs16a@berkeley.edu?

If you drop the class by the drop deadline, you'll receive a full refund (http://summer.berkeley.edu/registration/schedule). We request that you return the kit if this happens, and please let us know if you decide to drop the class as soon as you know.
Thank you!

Hi, I will be a freshman. I am planning to take 16A (if I don't get off the waitlist for 61A). What is the deadline to order the 16A kit, and can you please provide me the link? Thank you very much.

Are there any important deadlines related to 16A (other than the kits) that I need to know?
Lectures and discussion will be recorded, but of course you'll miss any interactive portions of discussion by watching the webcast. Labs and exams will require you to be online at specific times.
Wondering if lectures/discussion will be webcasted/recorded. Thanks

Lab kit pickup starts today. It will be available all days this week (6/15 - 6/19) from 1:30pm - 2:30pm from the 1st floor entrance of Cory Hall. Please make sure that you bring your SID with you to verify your identity.
Is there any followup on when to pick up the lab kits?
Try to email them. Tracking Numbers should be available...
Has there been any information about lab kits for student know are supposed to receive them in the mail?

history.content:
We are pleased to announce that EECS 16A will be offered this summer! 

This will happen during Session C (June 22 - August 14, eecs16_summer_offering). Enrollment for this session is open so we encourage all interested students to register!

 

Summer is a great opportunity for students who have not been able to fit 16A in their schedule so far or intend to take EECS 16B in the fall. We also expect to have better student-instructor ratio than fall and spring offerings.

 

EECS 16A focuses on the fundamentals of designing modern information devices and systems that interface with the real world. The course covers key linear-algebraic concepts, circuit design, and signal processing, and is aimed at entering students as well as non-majors seeking a broad foundation for the field. The summer offering will cover the same material with the same depth as the semester version.

 

This summer EECS 16A will be taught by Panos Zarkos, Grace Kuo, and Urmita Sikder. We are all graduate students in EECS who have multiple semesters of experience teaching and designing content for EECS 16A. We are all thrilled to offer the class and intend to make it a fun learning experience!!

 

See you in class!

UPDATE:

If you are taking the class, please fill out this form by as soon as possible to reserve your lab kit! You'll need the lab kit to complete the labs for the class!

UPDATE #2:

Lab kit pickup starts today and will be available from 15/6 to 19/6, 1:30pm - 2:30pm, from the 1st floor entrance of Cory Hall. Please make sure you bring you SID with you.
